Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property is located on the junction of St James Street and Market in the centre of Derby occupying a prominent corner location. Occupiers in close proximity include RBS, Primark, Walkabout, Frankie & Benny's, Superdrug and Cafe Nero.

Recent lettings in the vicinity include Turtle Bay and Revolution de Cuba.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over ground, first, second and basement.

Tenure
The property is currently held by way of a lease expiring 26th November 2027 with a tenant only option to break in November 2022.

A sub-lease of part of the premises may also be considered.

Rent
£105,000 per annum exclusive.

Alternatively a sub-lease can be agreed at rent to be negotiated.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £72,000.00 and the rates payable are £35,496.00 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 49.30p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: City Centre Retail Letting In Prominent Corner Location

Dynamic.PrimaryImage.Common.ImageCaption: DERBY_ 1 MARKET PLACE_3 ST JAMES ST IMAGE

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subject is located in Ashbourne, a market town in Derbyshire situated to the south of the Derbyshire Dales and approximately 13 miles north west of Derby, 14 miles north of Uttoxeter and 26 miles east of Stoke on Trent.
The retail centre is based on St Johns Street and Dig Street together with two retail schemes anchored by Boots and Waitrose respectively.
The Barclays Bank occupies a strong pitch in a central location.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The Bank is set over ground floor and first floor. The ground comprises usual cashier desk, interview rooms and back office space on ground floor with stairs providing access to the first floor where there is a staff room, wc's and ancillary storage space. The second floor is vacant storage space.

Tenure
The property is currently held on a lease expiring 18/06/2027 with a tenant only break option on 19/06/2022.

Rent
The current rent passing is £20,000 per annum, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £18,500.00 and the rates payable are £9,083.50 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Bakewell is an affluent and character-full market town in the heart of the Peak District. The town is located approximately 14 miles west of Chesterfield and 17 miles south west of Sheffield. Bakewell is a popular tourist destination, thus benefits from seasonal trade during the spring/summer months.

The unit itself is located on Bridge Street, with a return frontage onto Water Lane. The town comprises well established local retail/leisure operators along with national retailers including NatWest, WH Smiths and Fat Face.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over ground floor comprising a main sales area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 08/10/2026. 

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease until 08/10/2026.

Rent
The current passing rent is £36,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £16,250.00 and the rates payable are £8,108.75 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.90p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Chesterfield is a thriving historic market town which is popular with
shoppers and tourists alike. With a population in excess of 104,000
(Census, 2011) and a loyal catchment, Chesterfield is a strong retail
destination offering blend of shops, restaurants and a large open air
market.
A ground floor retail unit located in the pedestrianised shopping area of
Chesterfield with Tesco, Primark and Marks & Spencer all closeby.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
A ground floor retail unit with ancillary. The unit provides the following
approximate areas and dimensions:

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease
expiring 26 August 2028. Alternatively, the ground floor premises are
available by way of a sub-lease for a term of years to be agreed.

Rent
£48,000 per annum exclusive.

EPC
Energy Efficiency rating is D.
Energy Performance Certificate available on request.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £35,000 and the rates payable are £17,185.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/20 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property occupies a position on a retail parade in Creswell, located approximately 20 miles south east of Sheffield and 10 miles east of Chesterfield. Creswell train station is located a short distance from the unit, providing links to Sheffield and Chesterfield. Occupiers in the vicinity include local operators.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy the ground floor comprising a main sales area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 01/06/2025.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £5,200, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £5,900.00 and the rates payable are £2,944.10 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.90p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located within Dronfield, situated in the north-east of Derbyshire between Sheffield and Chesterfield. The branch lies within Dronfield Civic Centre where nearby national occupiers include; Barnardo’s Charity Shop, BetFred, McColl’s and Yorkshire Building Society.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises ground floor sales and first floor ancillary space.

Tenure
The property is held on a full repairing and insuring lease Expiring on 30th June 2019.

Passing Rent
£54,000 per annum.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £37,500.00 and the rates payable are £17,475.50 pa. The UBR for 2017/2018 is 46.6p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes
